info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 1:53AM CDT until April 24 at 9:01PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County.
For the Little Osage River...including Horton...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to late Thursday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs at the gage site. Low lying areas along Route D near Stotesbury flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 31.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 41.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 44.9 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 44.9 feet on 08/19/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING
